result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott J Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
07-07-2016/ Judge Janet C. Protasiewicz
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended  to state that the Proabtion term shall terminate on 09-25-2016.
** ** ** ** ** ** ** 

*6/24/2016  Court terminated probation effective 8/2/2016.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

**Court grants early termination from probation if all conditions are completed**

miscConds.notes:
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Provide DNA Sample.

-Obtain/maintain employment.
 Court grants defendant ability to maintain employment in Illinois.

-No contact with victim Kimberly J. unless approved by the agent.
 Defendant able to maintain contact with child through Family Court conditions.

-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
 Defendant to provide verification of already completed classes. DOC to confirm verification.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.

-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

timeConds.notes:
-Serve 30 days in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
*6/24/2016  STAYED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott J Johnson

records.addlTxt: reflects 07-07-2016 order amending probation termination date to 09-25-2016
Signed, Filed, and Distributed; Order Amending Judgment of COnviction to state that the probation term shall terminate on September 25, 2016.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify probation term on count two.

Defendant Scott J Johnson in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed. Court terminated probation effective 8/1/2016. Court found that further review is not needed.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties, Kimberly J., and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 day time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 30 days in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes. Defendant to provide verification of already completed classes. DOC to confirm verification.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim Kimberly J. unless approved by the agent. Defendant able to maintain contact with child through Family Court conditions.
-Obtain/maintain employment. Court grants defendant ability to maintain employment in Illinois.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

**Court grants early termination from probation if all conditions are completed**

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
-Certificate of Participation
-BIP Information Paperwork
-Letter from victim to court
-Parenting Network Paperwork.

Probation Review Hearing in branch 24.

Defendant Scott J Johnson in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Final Pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution. Court VACATES Jury Trial date. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 1 Dismissed, But Read In. 

AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. 

  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Court allows for contact of the defendant and the victim in the presence of their divorce counsels.

Defendant Scott J Johnson in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk    Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference and jury trial in Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact orders to a No Violent Contact order.  State opposes.  Court orders third party contact by e-mail between the victim and defendant, and third party contact for childcare.

Defendant Scott J Johnson in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Status Conference. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Defendant not to possess any firearms or dangerous weapons a a condition of bail. Court ordered that the remaining bail ($300.00) to be returned to the remitter.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KDJ (D.O.B. 11-13-1978); and the child.

Defendant Scott J Johnson in court with attorney Adam c Essling.   Tyrone St. Junior Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

01/05/2016
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/8/16 @ 1:30p
